page.title: 08CHEDDAR LIBRARY
page.content: The library in Cheddar was started during the last war by a man named Mr.J.J.Tyson who was headmaster of the Primary School at that time.The home of Cheddar library was the Parish Hall until it was moved to its present home next to Brice's shop in Union Street in 1975.The library has about 9250 books and is divided into three sections,fiction,non fiction and there is a very good children's area. Each person is allowed to borrow up to six books for a month.If they are not returned on time you have to pay 10p a day fine.The library is open on Monday Wednesday,Friday and on Saturday morning. It is also the TOURIST INFORMATION OFFICE.
